channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - HP Hero
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Senate Majority Leader McConnell publicly recognizes Biden's win. The comments are significant and only came after the Electoral College affirmed it.
item.description: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said Tuesday that following the electors meeting on Monday, "as of this morning, our country officially has a President-elect and a vice president-elect."

item.title: Read Mitch McConnell's full remarks recognizing Joe Biden as president-elect
Analysis: Biden sends his most blunt signal yet
item.description: On a day of hope, tragedy and constitutional affirmation, the United States could at last sense eventual deliverance from the twin menaces of 2020: a murderous virus and a vanquished President's quest to extinguish democracy.

item.title: Analysis: The 'urban myth' behind the GOP claims of voter fraud
item.description: The Supreme Court's rejection last week of the lawsuit from Texas and 18 other Republican-led states effectively ended the legal efforts by President Donald Trump and his allies to overturn his election defeat.

item.title: Kasich praises Biden for these two speech moments
item.description: Former Governor of Ohio John Kasich (R) discusses how the Republican Party is feeling after the Electoral College formally affirms Joe Biden's presidential win.

item.title: Congress has the next -- and final -- vote in the 2020 election. Here's how it works
item.description: Voters voted. States counted the votes. Challenges were heard and rejected. Now the Electoral College has made President-elect Joe Biden's victory completely official.

item.title: Putin finally congratulates Biden on US election victory
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin congratulated Joe Biden on his victory in the US presidential election Tuesday, six weeks after the vote and a day after the Electoral College officially affirmed Biden's win.

item.title: Opinion: Shut the door on Trump by ending the electoral college
item.description: America's electoral college, an institution rooted in racial slavery, must be abolished.

item.title: Hear about Trump's plan after Electoral College vote
item.description: President Donald Trump's attacks on the 2020 presidential election will continue even after the Electoral College affirms President-elect Joe Biden won, according to a White House adviser. CNN's Jim Acosta reports.

item.title: Congressman leaves GOP over his disgust with Trump
item.description: • Analysis: Don't make Paul Mitchell a political hero just yet • Analysis: This Republican senator apparently has no idea what a 'gotcha' question actually is

item.title: Covid vaccines will make little impact on the devastating winter ahead
item.description: • Live updates: FDA panel document confirms Moderna's Covid-19 vaccine's efficacy ahead of Thursday meeting • Fauci recommends Trump and Pence get vaccinated for Covid-19 • Farmworkers, firefighters and flight attendants jockey for vaccine priority

item.title: Attorney General William Barr resigns
item.description: William Barr will be leaving his role as attorney general, President Donald Trump tweeted on Monday evening.

item.title: A stimulus deal that includes an extension of jobless benefits is within reach
item.description: It's now time for congressional leaders to finally show their cards -- and make some critical decisions.

item.title: See what George Conway thinks about Trump's refusal to concede
item.description: George Conway, conservative lawyer and former White House counselor Kellyanne Conway's husband, discusses President Trump's refusal to concede after the Electoral College made Joe Biden's win official.

item.title: Analysis: How it all went wrong for Gavin Newsom
item.description: Back in April, near the start of the coronavirus pandemic in the United States, I wrote a piece with this headline: "Gavin Newsom may be the most underrated governor in the country right now."

item.title: 'Made up': Burnett reacts to Stephen Miller's election claim on Fox News
item.description: Laurence Tribe, a constitutional law professor at Harvard, debunks Stephen Miller's false claim that "alternate" electors could be sent to Congress to overturn Biden's win.

item.title: A powerful nor'easter is forecast to strike most of the eastern coast
item.description: Over 45 million Americans are under a winter storm watch as a powerful Nor'easter takes aim at the East Coast.

item.title: Ann Reinking, Broadway star who played Roxie Hart in 'Chicago,' dies at 71
item.description: Ann Reinking, the Broadway star who played Roxie Hart in the musical "Chicago," has died, her manager Lee Gross confirmed to CNN in an email late Monday. She was 71.

item.title: Boko Haram claims to have kidnapped Nigerian schoolboys, in unverified audio message
item.description: A man claiming to be a leader of Boko Haram said the terror group was responsible for kidnapping scores of schoolboys in northwestern Nigeria on Friday, according to a short audio message shared with Nigerian media and reviewed by CNN.

item.title: Opinion: The four issues that could unite a divided America
item.description: With Joe Biden set to inherit a divided America in January, he'll face considerable challenges, all of which will be made harder without cooperation, consensus-building and compromise. But with the far extremes of both parties resistant to coming together, who will be there to work with? This week, CNN political commentators Van Jones and Alice Stewart tackle this in our discussion, but first, Van Jones writes our op-ed: What comes next for America and unity? --SE Cupp

item.title: Loeffler condemns White supremacist after taking photo with him
item.description: Georgia GOP Sen. Kelly Loeffler's campaign disavowed a photo spreading on social media of her smiling next to a White supremacist at a campaign event on Friday, as her Democratic opponent and others criticized her for it ahead of the January 5 runoff elections for control of the Senate.

item.title: Russian agents were on his trail before he was poisoned. When he survived, alarm bells rang in Moscow
item.description: At about 9 a.m. on August 13, a 33-year-old Russian woman named Maria Pevchikh checked in for a flight from Moscow to the Siberian city of Novosibirsk. She was not alone.

item.title: Avlon: Massive suspected Russian hack is 21st century warfare
item.description: CNN's John Avlon breaks down the recent data breach of multiple federal agencies by what US officials suspect are Russian-linked hackers and how President Trump has responded to Russian breaches in the past.

item.title: Cleveland's plans to drop 'Indians' from team name is a welcome change but it's long overdue, Native Americans say
item.description: A Major League Baseball team's decision to remove "Indians" from its name is being hailed as historic, but Native American advocacy groups insist their fight to remove all racist sports mascots is far from over.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle sign exclusive podcast deal with Spotify
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are podcasters now.

item.title: Pornhub removes a majority of its videos after investigation reveals child abuse
item.description: Pornhub has removed a majority of its content -- millions of explicit videos -- uploaded from unverified users as part of a series of changes following allegations that the site showed videos of child abuse and nonconsensual sexual behavior.

item.title: He had a lucrative career in drag. Now he's looking for call center work
item.description: Harry Mason, known by his stage name Sasha Cassadine, went from a lucrative career in drag, to not knowing where his next paycheck was coming from during the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Japanese 'Twitter killer' sentenced to death for murders of nine people
item.description: A Japanese man dubbed the "Twitter killer" who pleaded guilty to killing nine people in a high-profile mass murder case in 2017 was sentenced to death on Tuesday, the Tokyo District Court Tachikawa branch confirmed to CNN.

item.title: How freediver earned the nickname 'Deepest Man on Earth'
item.description: Freediver Herbert Nitsch earned the nickname "Deepest Man on Earth" by diving underwater to 830 feet on a single breath. He explains how he found his sport and recovered from his accident.

item.title: Is your current credit card skimping on rewards?
The pandemic has destroyed friendships and divided families
item.description: Abby Mahler ended a childhood friendship in the comments of one of her Instagram posts.

item.title: Your home is a hotspot for Covid, studies say
item.description: With Covid-19 surging in the United States, transmission of the novel coronavirus is at an all-time high.

item.title: It's not just doctors and nurses who are getting the first vaccines. Some housekeeping staff are at the top of the list
item.description: The first Pfizer and BioNTech Covid-19 vaccines are here, but it's not just doctors and nurses who are getting them first.

item.title: Sharon Osbourne says she was briefly hospitalized with Covid-19
item.description: Sharon Osbourne has revealed she's tested positive for Covid-19.

item.title: Opinion: Why the astonishing vaccine rollout broke the speed record
item.description: On Friday evening, the US Food and Drug Administration authorized the first Covid-19 vaccine, developed by Pfizer and BioNTech, for emergency use.

item.title: Nurse inspired new Marvel comic book
item.description: Marvel Comics collaborated with Allegheny Health Network and created a comic book to honor nurses who have been on the frontlines of the coronavirus pandemic. CNN's John Avlon discusses with Amanda Belcastro, who is featured in the comic, and Marvel writer Sean Ryan.

item.title: A Covid vaccine is here. Here's what NOT to do
item.description: The country's first Covid-19 vaccines could be administered as soon as Monday, after the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine received green lights from the US Food and Drug Administration and the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

item.title: Wisconsin Department of Health warns against eating the 'cannibal sandwich'
item.description: Wisconsin residents are being urged by health officials to pass on eating a traditional holiday dish this year to avoid getting sick.

item.title: Would you eat nachos from a trash can?
item.description: Guy Fieri, a champion of food heavy on the fun and light on nutrition, has rather a singular place in the food world.

item.title: FDA approves new genetically modified pig for allergy-free medical and food products
item.description: The US Food and Drug Administration said Monday it has approved a genetically modified pig whose body doesn't make a component that can trigger allergies in people.

item.title: Dinosaur sported impressive mane and had ribbons protruding from its shoulders
item.description: A newly identified dinosaur was about the size of a chicken, sported an impressive mane and had stiff, ribbon-like structures protruding from its shoulders.

item.title: Dolly Parton's daily schedule: 3 a.m. wake-ups and heels in the kitchen
item.description: Ever wonder what it's like to be Dolly Parton for a day? Well, for one, you'll certainly be working more than 9 to 5.

item.title: This robotaxi from Amazon's Zoox has no reverse function
item.description: This self-driving robotaxi from Amazon's Zoox can travel up to 75 mph and never has to turn around. Check out this electric vehicle made for crowded city streets.

item.title: 'Zoom face,' TikTok hacks and DIY self-care: 2020's biggest beauty trends
item.description: In a year that many of us spent indoors or hidden behind a mask, the way we think about beauty has changed more profoundly than, perhaps, at any other time in living memory.

item.title: America's CEOs have advice for Biden's long road ahead
item.description: More than two dozen leading chief executives offer advice to the incoming Biden administration.

item.title: Classic luxury car brands stage million-dollar comebacks
item.description: If you haven't spent time at high-end classic car shows, then you may never have heard of Delage, Hispano-Suiza or De Tomaso. But these long dormant brands have an adoring fan base among wealthy car collectors. And now, new companies are looking to capitalize on that attraction by bringing them back.

item.title: Meghan Markle invests in trendy oat milk latte company
item.description: Meghan Markle, the Duchess of Sussex, is betting big on oat milk.

item.title: Cost of being the ultimate Apple fan: $80,000
item.description: Picture this: You are the ultimate Apple fan. You've got an unlimited budget. And you want all of the things: top-of-the-line devices, fancy accessories and services.

item.title: Streaming is about to get a lot more expensive
item.description: Disney threw down the gauntlet to its competitors last week, with a slate of remarkable programming on Disney+ alongside some eye-popping subscriber numbers and forecasts.

item.title: 33 clever stocking stuffers from Amazon you can snag for under $15
The best sales to shop today: Marmot, Ninja, Samsung and more
The best smart speakers of 2020
23 unique gifts you'll wish you'd thought of earlier
28 clever gifts you'll want to use while working from home
16 splurge-worthy gifts under $1,000, because they deserve it
The best gifts to give under $50
One of Oprah's Favorite Things, this bracelet arrives by Christmas
23 little things from Amazon that make a big difference
43 gifts every woman in your life would love to receive
These are our favorite store credit cards for 2021
The best coupons at JCPenney
Barr can't erase his shameful legacy
item.description: William Barr will soon be gone as attorney general.

item.title: 'The Crown' uproar is about more than the royals
item.description: Great Britain has declared war on Netflix. (Almost.)

item.title: What Obama gets wrong on 'defund the police'
item.description: When former President Barack Obama warned Democrats against using a "snappy slogan" like "defund the police," the backlash from progressives was swift.

item.title: This new holiday movie would have changed everything for my teenage self
item.description: As a pop culture writer and lover of all things TV, I love cozying up on the weekends and watching holiday rom-coms -- but for me, there was always one thing noticeably absent from all the chance meetings, almost-kisses and happily-ever-afters: a disabled actor in the lead role.

item.title: What John Adams could teach Trump
item.description: As President Donald Trump's defeat has been confirmed numerous times and courts have rejected his campaign's efforts to dispute the vote count, some of his loyalists have shown a growing urgency. Last Saturday, thousands of pro-Trump supporters in Washington and in several state capitals hit the streets in last-ditch protests to save an election they believe was stolen. As darkness fell, a large group of Trump backers faced off against a mass of counter protesters in front of the Supreme Court. The confrontation vaulted into fistfights, stab wounds, arrests and turmoil.

item.title: Doctors: Here's why we're taking Covid-19 vaccine
item.description: The two of us, as emergency physicians, will be among the earliest recipients of vaccines against SARS-CoV-2, the novel coronavirus that causes Covid-19.

item.title: The logjam that awaits Biden's education secretary
item.description: No amount of teaching experience, policy expertise or ambition will neutralize the political reality the next US Secretary of Education faces. Equal and adequate schooling has faced a two-decade logjam at the federal level and another longer one at the state and local level. No secretary will break it in 100 days or even a year. But an earnestly humble one might have a shot at changing how the game is played.

item.title: Here's who Joe Biden has selected for his Cabinet
item.description: President-elect Joe Biden is building out his Cabinet as he prepares for his time in the White House.
